ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] QuotaEnforcer not working properly ?!
ygData.msgSnippet: You have to upgrade to a newer version (1.7.x - can t remember which exact version) Two new setting has been introduced in the QuotaEnforcer:

Content-type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-transfer-encoding: 8BIT

You have to upgrade to a newer version (1.7.x - can't remember which exact version)
Two new setting has been introduced in the QuotaEnforcer: host-max-fetch-responses & host-max-all-kb - they both counts all requests 
including error-requests

best
Bjarne Andersen
netarchive.dk

Thimo Eichstaedt wrote:
> Hello,
> 
> I am using QuotaEnforcer (max documents per host) and I am limiting
> the max document size.
> 
> I think this combination isn't working in heritrix 1.6.0:
> QuotaEnforcer only counts the successfull fetches (and only
> interpretes 200 as successful), but in my crawls many server return
> status code 206, because heritrix is sending a partial content
> request when limiting the document size. So the number of documents
> often exceeds the quota settings...
> 
> So, why the QuotaEnforcer only treats 200 responses as successful
> fetches and is there an option to get it working right ?
> 
> thanks
>    Thimo
> 
>
